description: Opens browser, loads reddit, asks for permission, then nothing
thank you, i could never find a reddit app for Linux but thank you I'm really impressed here, easy to use and login, very user friendly.
It also adapts well to smaller screens, so it works on linux phones as well!
summary: One of the best GTK reddit apps I've used

description: Well refined and easy to use
Thanks for free app, however it doesn't work blank screen for me. Maybe I have second authentication enabled for Reddit, that is why?

App works pefectly fine and looks to be responsive on large and small screens based on resizing the window. Previously was having issues with the Yaru theme on Ubuntu 20.04 but everything looks smoothed out now ?

If you want to post something on your profile you can't it either has to be subreddit or other user who has recently contacted with you. I'd recommend any developer who sees this comment to have a look at few other features too. Thanks!
summary: Overall it's ok! But, lacks development and features

description: i was about to delate the app but the second time i opened, it load everything. i dont know why but is working fine now. i love it.
summary: second time i open the app and it works fine

description: Click Login... just sits and waits for "authentication" with a spinning circle. I let it roll for 2-3 minutes. It never gets past this. PinePhone running Mobian.
wont get past the login screen
It opens up a page on Firefox and refuses to move foreward when I press "Allow". I closed it and tried again. Same result.
summary: Not recommended - Cannot use with Ubuntu 20.04 and Firefox

description:
It brings up reddit in the browser, but when you click allow, the app crashes. 

manjaro arm64 phosh on pinephone
Crashes the moment you grant it access to your account.
open browser. its all
This app never signs into reddit....Ever
Using on the Pinephone with Mobian/Phosh and it works perfectly! Unfortunately, I don't have gtk4 available yet so the latest update doesnt *look* the greatest, but that's not because of the program.
Might be good but I don't want to login to read reddit so I can't use the app.
The best Reddit client I've used so far!
the fonts arent great. imited function.
this doesnt work keeps closing every time

can we please scrap snaps because they don't work devs need to get a grip because they don't work seriously or people will leave ubuntu because people are to lazy to fix the damn problem that canocial caused get a grip and get a life
The concept of a GTK Reddit client is really cool. However, the scaling of the posts is way too big in full screen mode, and it crashes on multiple occasions on my PC.
summary: I really like it, but it has some quirks

description: Evertimes I click on a post or load more content, the app gets so laggy
summary: Good app but it gets laggy at times

description: I'll hoped for a stand alone Reddit app to use on my laptop for a long time. Giara is on the right path but unfortunately is way too laggy for practical use. I will definitely be keeping track of this project and hope it will be a usable product in the near future.
summary: Show's promise and I hope that dev will continue working to improve

description:
Trying to launch giara from the commandline resulted in this error:

AttributeError: module 'mistune' has no attribute 'HTMLRenderer'
I think it would be a neat app but it just crahses.
Porting over from the browser to Giara was a breeze and there isn't any visible problem to me.
I tried several times to start the application, but nothing happened.
In order for this to work, you need to install gir1.2-gtk-4.0, gir1.2-adw-1, and gir1.2-gtksource-5. After those are installed, it still throws some errors on the console, but it works.
Won't progress past the login screen.

All it does is crash upon boot. Nothing else. I would advise against installing this to not waste your time. Also judging by the gitlab it seems to be abandoned, theirs been no response from the developer on issues in over a half a year. Unfortunate as Linux doesn't have a native launcher for reddit.

Surprisingly considering the API changes, this app still manages to function. It might crash out inital login but re-opening the app works.

My main concern at this point is the fact that this app hasen't been updated for 10 months and seen it's last contribution 2 months ago. The future is uncertain for Giara. I hope it's not adandoned but it's looking like it might be.

very gpoogd
fffffffffffff

Dont know what I am doing wrong, for login it opens the browser, I accept and want to open the link in the app, the app crashes / vanishes and when starting it has done nothing and the same happens again.

KDE Neon latest version
Crashed when you try to connect your account. No error message nothing
After Starting it, it loads in the Taskbar and then it closes directly-
Le doy a "Iniciar Sesión", me abre un web donde le doy a "Permitir", y en eso se cierra la app. Vuelvo a abrir la app y se repite el proceso. No funciona.
Low space needed but too much RAM. For basic use it takes nearly 2gb. No split or grid view

Just infinite loop of AWAITING AUTHORIZATIONS and when allow permission on popup reddit page about third parties app it is JUST CLOSE and nothing happens, start over and it infinite loop again and again and again. FIX please. DEBIAN 11 x86_64.
